data.title: The Bakken Museum
data.meta_description: The Bakken Museum inspires a passion for innovation by exploring the potential for science, technology, and the humanities to make the world a better place. data.text:
Inspiring a Passion for Innovation

Welcome to The Bakken Museum

ABOUT THE BAKKEN MUSEUM

The Bakken Museum inspires a passion for innovation by exploring the potential for science, technology, and the humanities to make the world a better place. Located on the West shore of Bde Maka Ska in Minneapolis, the museum features interactive exhibits for all ages and exceptional STEM education programs. Make movies in the Spark exhibit, meet the mother of science fiction in Mary & Her Monster, and test out some of Ben Franklin's favorite experiments in the Electricity Party Room.

Visit Us

3537 Zenith Avenue South

Minneapolis, MN 55416

HOURS

Open: Tuesday – Sunday, 10 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Closed: Monday

featured exhibits

Play music on the Bakkenspiel, make stop-motion movies at the Animation Station, and connect with human stories in Personal Prostheses 2.0.

Benjamin Franklin’s curiosity led him to explore many novel ideas and devices of his time. Join the party and try out some electric parlor tricks!

Who is Mary Shelley and why is her novel important today? Explore the science, technology, and culture that influenced the mother of science fiction.

“The Bakken is a great place for anyone looking to explore, learn, spark imagination and expand curiosity. We will be back.”

– Visitor Review

“Interesting, interactive exhibits in a beautiful space. A perfect afternoon activity.”

– Visitor Review
